Context:
The George Brown College School of Management provides a hands-on business education leading to various work opportunities domestically and internationally. Their faculty keeps industry connections to ensure relevant learning for students. Courses focus on both technical and soft skills, such as teamwork, communication, leadership, decision making, strategy formulation, project management, and problem-solving. Graduates work in industries like logistics and project management, manufacturing and retail sectors, financial institutions, government offices, consulting firms, and other organizations.

The college offers online postgraduate certificates for working professionals, providing flexibility with evening and weekend schedules. Students can develop professional skills in a year or less with some programs including a work term. The Entry Advising service is free and helps match skills, background, and career goals to program options. Appointments, information sessions, and campus tours are available.

Contact: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca
Social Media Hub: Visit Our Social Media Hub

Programs offerings and fees are subject to change without notice. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
